DOC.brief_summary: Clinical research study determine anti-plaque efficacy commerical dentifrice oral rinse .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Commercial Anti-Plaque Products Oral Rinse
DOC.detailed_description: This clinical research study train new examiner short term plaque clinical methodology .
DOC.criteria: Male female volunteer least 18 year age . Good general health . Must sign inform consent form . Minimum 20 natural uncrowned teeth ( exclude third molar ) must present . No history allergy personal care consumer product , ingredient , relevant ingredient test product determine dental/medical professional monitoring study . Subjects unable unwilling sign inform consent form . Medical condition require premedication prior dental visits/procedures . Moderate advance periodontal disease heavy dental tartar ( calculus ) . Two decay untreated dental site screen . Other disease hard soft oral tissue . Impaired salivary function ( e.g . Sjogren 's syndrome head neck irradiation ) . Use medication currently affect salivary function . Use antibiotic antimicrobial drug within 30 day prior study visit # 1 . Allergy chlorhexidine . Pregnant nursing woman . Participation clinical study within 1 week prior enrollment study . Use tobacco product . Subjects must receive dental treatment study date . Current use Antibiotics premedication dental treatment purpose . Presence orthodontic appliance interferes plaque score . History allergy common dentifrice ingredient . Immune compromised individual ( HIV , AIDS , immuno suppressive drug therapy ) .
